body:
> @jonkerj could we avoid that folder to move on? cc @basvanbeek

Sure, but I wouldn't know how. I am not familiar with the build system (it's maven, right?) and got lost trying to find this out. If someone can point me to other stuff getting ignored by this check, I'll see that I replicate that to my folder.

> I am currently struggling with local test on a `amd64` machine. The following error messages appeared when I simply ran a command for docker-build like:
> 
> ```
> $ git clone https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin.git
> $ cd zipkin
> $ # add '-X' option at https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/build-bin/maven/maven_build#L23
> $ build-bin/docker/docker_build openzipkin/zipkin:test
> ...
> log messages
> ...
> #17 32.97 [ERROR] Failed to execute goal com.github.eirslett:frontend-maven-plugin:1.11.0:npm (npm lint) on project zipkin-lens: Failed to run task: 'npm run lint' failed. org.apache.commons.exec.ExecuteException: Process exited with an error: 254 (Exit value: 254) -> [Help 1]

> ```
> 
> Could someone point me out to how to do successful local test?

It turns out that the following command should be run first:
```
$ ./mvnw -T1C -q --batch-mode -DskipTests --also-make -pl zipkin-server clean package
```
@llinder I would be very grateful if you could review this. Thank you very much.
@trustin @huydx any feedback on this?
Bump

@jonkerj
ingress.yaml:
`{{- $svcPort := .Values.service.port -}}`   should be `{{- $svcPort := .Values.service.zipkin.port -}}`
values.yaml:
`service:
  tracing:
    type: ClusterIP
    port: 80
  zipkin:
    type: ClusterIP
    port: 9411
`
Anyway... good work.. Thank you!

@mrfelek : thanks for the sharp eye, don't know how we could have missed that. Still looking for hints on how to exclude the chart subdir from the license header check. Can anyone point me towards the right direction?
@jonkerj are you on twitter? I'd like to have a word with you.
I'm sorry, I'm not on Twitter. I'm on several slacks (Talos, CNCF, Cilium, Kubernetes), though
Do these CVEs effect 2.23.5? We fixed several in that release which I believe covers the ones mentioned here.
Do these CVEs effect 2.23.5? We fixed several in that release which I believe covers the ones mentioned here.
This CVE should effect 2.23.5 because still the latest version of zipkin-server(2.23.5) refers to kafka-clients-2.7.0.jar file(vulnerability version)
Netty was updated in 2.23.5 which should fix this.
Netty was updated in 2.23.5 which should fix this.

+1

Turns out Thrift brought in Tomcat for some tests :-( 
Released 2.23.9  that doesn't include these transitive dependencies.
These should be addressed by 2.23.9 so going to close this ticket.
Released 2.23.9 with fixes that should cover these. I also ran [trivy](https://github.com/aquasecurity/trivy) and everything looks good as far as CVEs are concerned now.
2.23.9 should fix these. Running [trivy](https://github.com/aquasecurity/trivy) doesn't raise these as an issue anymore so going to close this ticket.

@llinder are we OK merging this now?

Don't want to sound impatient, but I've got the feeling this PR and the conversation around it is stalling a bit. Don't get me wrong: we really love to help in getting this chart included, and believe it would boost the adaption of Zipkin in a Kubernetes environment. 

If this has no priority from the main devs: totally fine and we'd respect that, and we will find a different approach, but please be clear about this.
Let's merge this I will address the headers in a next PR.
@vy8 could you add a unit test for this?
Fixed by https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/3394
Thanks @jonkerj!

OK, it was kind of tricky to test, because:
- The CD workflow needs to be in the default branch (ie, `master`)
- The workflow is only triggered by changes in `chart/**`

So, what I did:
1. I forked the repo (actually, already had a fork to create this PR)
2. merged the branch into `master` (so the CD action was in place)
3. changed something bogus under `chart/`, committing it into `master`
4. Observed a helm-release was cut out
5. Branched master, changed something bogus again, create a PR
6. Observed that the chart was getting linted

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/951654/144613576-2761ae9f-4700-4a25-a649-445ea83882a2.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/951654/144613638-48e29c83-6bd7-4b87-9877-8144bec75197.png)

Awesome, thank you!

Hey @jcchavezs just did. Even thought it's a simple test that checks if startMillis is smaller than endMillis it will fail with the old code that doesn't have the explicit 'L' for long.

Hmmm. If I'm not mistaken, Zipkin has written it's own Elasticsearch client, so my knowledge here will be very shallow.

I assume we're talking about https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/zipkin-storage/elasticsearch/src/main/java/zipkin2/elasticsearch/internal/JsonSerializers.java#L67? I don't think that's really on the Elasticsearch side (which is not a solution, I know 😕)

More details:

Response:
![response](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22779039/145167272-3551d381-d6a4-4349-9316-726c3b2f4f44.png)


Indices:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22779039/145166643-5e040b13-62b1-4cd7-9da6-2eb73625e7e8.png)

Role (We gave more than what it needs!):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22779039/145167358-984fc9aa-b54f-4fad-8657-58bbfa70e4db.png)

Mappings:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22779039/145207010-21ea2fdc-6d83-4bb8-b3e7-f822f2c1fdfb.png)

Yes, I don't think this is an Elasticsearch issue — you can write and read data. The problem is somewhere in the Zipkin codebase visualizing the data and it runs into a NPE (maybe some missing field; not exactly sure).

Hi there, my guess is that as `sasl.jaas.config` contains spaces, the Java process is not loaded properly. Similar to https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18358660/passing-system-properties-that-contains-spaces-to-tomcat-through-java-opts

Could you give a try loading properties from a file instead?

OK, I've tried the standard jar file in a container with the following yaml file:

```
armeria:
  ports:
    - port: 8888
      ip: 0.0.0.0
      protocol: HTTP

zipkin:
  collector:
    # percentage to traces to retain
    sample-rate: 1.0
    kafka:
      enabled: true
      # Kafka bootstrap broker list, comma-separated host:port values. Setting this activates the
      # Kafka 0.10+ collector.
      bootstrap-servers: xxx.confluent.cloud:9092
      # Name of topic to poll for spans
      topic: zipkin
      # Consumer group this process is consuming on behalf of.
      group-id: zipkin-server
      overrides:
        sasl.jaas.config: org.apache.kafka.common.security.plain.PlainLoginModule required username="<user>" password="<pass>";
        sasl.mechanism: PLAIN
        security.protocol: SASL_SSL
        ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithm: https
  logging:
    pattern:
      level: "%clr{%5p} %clr{[%X{traceId}/%X{spanId}]}{yellow}"
    level:
      zipkin2: DEBUG
      org.apache.kafka: DEBUG
```

that works fine.

I've tried the same file in the standard docker image (over writing the file /zipkin/BOOT-INF/classes/zipkin-server-shared.yml
and it fails in the orignal way, with the missing class

are you using a stripped down java runtime image that's missing the security module?

I couldn't work out how to use a properties file dropping an application.properties into /zipkin/BOOT-INF/classes didn't seem to have any descerable effect - I couldn't find any documentation on it either, I'm sure I'm missing something obvious here. I'm also assuming that the yaml translates to the following properties:

```
zipkin.collector.kafka.enabled: true
zipkin.collector.kafka.bootstrap-servers: xxx.confluent.cloud:9092
zipkin.collector.kafka.topic: zipkin
zipkin.collector.kafka.group-id: zipkin-server
zipkin.collector.kafka.overrides.sasl.jaas.config: org.apache.kafka.common.security.plain.PlainLoginModule required username="<user>" password="<password>";
zipkin.collector.kafka.overrides.sasl.mechanism: PLAIN
zipkin.collector.kafka.overrides.security.protocol: SASL_SSL
zipkin.collector.kafka.overrides.ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithm: https
```

@msillence same here, I've been trying to find the best way to override this properties, but I haven't been able to find how to do this with spring-boot configuration handling. 

Ping @shakuzen or @timtebeek. Maybe you have already face similar challenges.

solution for this issue

https://javadoc.io/static/com.linecorp.armeria/armeria-javadoc/1.7.2/com/linecorp/armeria/common/Flags.html

public static long defaultMaxResponseLength()
Returns the default client-side maximum length of a response. Note that this flag has no effect if a user specified the value explicitly via [ClientBuilder.maxResponseLength(long)](https://javadoc.io/static/com.linecorp.armeria/armeria-javadoc/1.7.2/com/linecorp/armeria/client/ClientBuilder.html#maxResponseLength(long)).
The default value of this flag is 10485760L. Specify the -Dcom.linecorp.armeria.defaultMaxResponseLength=<long> to override the default value. 0 disables the length limit.

-Dcom.linecorp.armeria.defaultMaxResponseLength=<long>

Thanks a lot. Do you think something es missing in the documentation?
